Responsibility:
As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Logistics Optimization, you will:

Design, build, deploy and operate machine learning and optimization applications that are responsible for improving the supply chain and warehouse operations, such as: efficiently grouping of store orders, optimizing order picking, ensuring products are transported sustainably
Work on high-impact and performance-critical applications that are at the heart of the Albert Heijn supply chain
Use the Albert Heijn Azure cloud platform and tooling to deploy production-grade machine learning software
Collaborate with (technical) stakeholders across the company to gather, document and transform requirements into practical solutions
Work in multidisciplinary product teams to tackle real-world logistics challenges
Share your expertise and coach other team members
Specific Required Skills/Keywords:
We're looking for candidates who have:

A Master's degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or a related field (or equivalent relevant experience and interest)
A strong understanding of Operations Research and Data Science algorithms, as well as their real-world applications in logistics, such as demand forecasting and route optimization
A pragmatic, hands-on approach to problem-solving with a focus on getting things done
A willingness to actively collaborate, for example through code reviews and knowledge-sharing sessions
A willingness to proactively gather context from various stakeholders in the organization (business users, other data science teams, tech teams, etc.)
A generalist mindset and a systems view of data science, with the ability to contribute across the entire stack, from data engineering to deployment
Shipped, deployed, operated and maintained data science solutions in production in the cloud, ideally in performance-critical systems
Proficiency in Python and the Python data science ecosystem
7+ years of relevant experience
Working experience in at least one compiled language, preferably in a systems language like C++ or Rust
Behavioral requirement: How does a jar of peanut butter make its way to the shelf at your local Albert Heijn? Does that question get you thinking about suppliers, pallets, distribution centers, trucks, and delivery routes? Do you start visualizing the planning, algorithms, and optimizations that ensure these processes run efficiently and sustainably? If terms like knapsack problems, the traveling salesman, linear programming, and meta-heuristics come to mind, you might be the perfect fit for our team! We're looking for curious, talented individuals to join and strengthen our Operations Analytics and Data Science team.
Company Values: At Albert Heijn, we operate on a just-in-time logistics model, which means there's no room for delays. Every optimization you help implement ensures our customers find their favorite products exactly when they need them. You'll be at the heart of our business, driving innovations that keep our shelves stocked efficiently and sustainably.
